body.p:
State of Kentucky
Livingston County } SS

Manerva Clemens says I was at home on the morning of the 25th of December 1861 and heard a conversation between W. W. Clemens & W. P. Clemens at our house W. W. Clemens said to W. P. Clemens that he did not want any Dificulty with Bozman and that you W. P. Clemens and Mr Bozman are good friends and if you will go with me I think we can make it up I think he will take Back some things he has Said and I am willing to be friendly with Mr Bozman W. P. Clemens Said to his Brother if he wish to make it up with Mr Bozman that he would go with him for he new him & Bozman ware on the best of terms and he believed Mr Bozman would take Back any thing wrong that he had said and ^they^ left home to go to Mr Bozman to make up the Dificulty between W. W. Clemens & Mr Bozman and I fuly believe that they went to Mr Bozmas to settle the Dificulty peacebly

This day Mrs. Minerva Clemens personaly appeared before me J T Bronsten an acting Justice of the Peace for Livingston County Ky & mad oath that the with in statements were true to the best of her knowledge & beleaf given under my hand this March the 2t 1865.
